definition: total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout

sentences.english: Within a short while the 13th Army Group was completely wiped out, with all its troops surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 第十三兵团随即全军覆没，所属部队全部投降。

sentences.english: In the Majiang Battle between China and France, Chinese Fujian Sea Fleet was almost annihilated.
sentences.chinese: 在中法马江之战中，中国的福建舰队几乎全军覆没。

sentences.english: "Even though he might've known they were going to be massacred, " amended Puller.
sentences.chinese: “即使他知道他们可能全军覆没，”普勒修正到。

sentences.english: The whole army went down in flames, and no one survived.
sentences.chinese: 那支部队全军覆没，无一生还。

sentences.english: The Necromancers are utterly destroyed in the War of the Broken Staff.
sentences.chinese: 在断杖之役中，亡灵巫师们全军覆没了。

sentences.english: Crushed between two armies, the remaining Dark Iron forces were utterly destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 剩余的黑铁部族部队被两面夹击，全军覆没。

definition: to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
